Um clássico. Tem seus momentos de irritação (principalmente pra subir e descer a porcaria das escadas), até por ser de outra era dos videogames, mas realmente é um excelente jogo. Os gráficos foram melhorados em comparação ao jogo original e as novas adições são realmente muito boas. Vale muito a pena jogar e presenciar a história dos FPS sendo feita. A jogabilidade é extremamente dinâmica, os inimigos bem construídos e a dificuldade bem equilibrada.  Ótimo jogo. Realmente um dos mais icônicos já feitos até hoje.

Half-Life: Source é simplesmente quase idêntico ao seu predecessor HL com o motor gráfico mais aprimorado que seria conhecido hoje como Base do Motor Valve Source 2 após anos de desenvolvimento, a campanha não muda significativamente em relação ao jogo anterior mencionado, além de ter uma nova visualidade gráfica e mecânica aprimorada, e como a atmosfera de HL está envolvida em mistérios e quebra-cabeças e momentos de ação e agilidade, certamente um acréscimo com uma melhora gráfica significativa.
A perfect example of how not to remaster a game, very bugged, and many environmental sounds missing. I would rather recommend playing the original version.

10/10

A remastered but unfortunately inferior version of Half-Life. While this port to Half-Life 2's Source engine improves the game in many respects to the level of the sequel, it is also very buggy at the moment. Nothing game-breaking, I managed to finish it, but especially misaligned hitboxes were very frustrating, even on easy difficulty. I recommend playing the stable original instead or the modern fan remake Black Mesa.

*Análise atrasada* 

Eles querem sua cabeça por saber demais, você conseguirá escapar com vida?

Half-Life é um jogo antigo conhecido mundialmente que eu queria jogar já fazia um tempo, será que ele faz jus a sua reputação? A resposta é sim. 
Vou falar que esse jogo não faz bem o meu estilo, mas ainda assim eu gostei. 
A história gira em torno do cientista Gordon Freeman, que trabalha em uma instalação secreta chamada Black Mesa, localizada em algum lugar no deserto do Novo México. Freeman está ajudando alguns outros cientistas em um experimento com um cristal supostamente de outro mundo, quando algo deu terrivelmente errado. Acontece um evento chamado Cascata de Ressonância em que, basicamente, o cristal usado ressoou além do limite e começou a abrir portais entre o mundo Xen e o planeta terra. Depois disso é só caos. 
A jogabilidade é boa, nada muito espetacular, afinal, é um jogo de 98. O modo de tiro me satisfez e é bem estável. Você pode andar, agachar, pular e interagir com coisas. 
O arsenal não é tão grande, mas dá pro gasto. 
Os gráficos são ok. Essa versão conta com o visual levemente melhorado graças a engine Source.

Half-Life: Source é um ótimo jogo para você que está procurando um jogo com uma boa história e uma lore vasta. 

7/10

Ainda tenho que fazer a análise do Half-Life 2, mas não sei quando vai sair. Já estava na metade do episódio 2 e perdi todo o meu progresso, p*ta preguiça de fazer tudo de novo kkkkkkkkk.

Es un gran juego, la estructura en general se siente un poco antigua pero es muy disfrutable.
Solo tengo algunas quejas, en el menú existen opciones de subtítulos pero no se pueden utilizar (por lo que leí es un error al utilizar el motor de Half Life 2), también hay algunos bugs visuales y finalmente digamos que no tiene "todo Half Life" hacen falta las dos expansiones originales.
En conclusión, juegalo si no lo has jugado, está versión es buena para comenzar en la saga.

Not a very well polished product under Valve's name, but when I finished the game, I honestly thought it wasn't that bad for an experimental remake. 

There are bugs that are still prevalent, the worst one for me being the Apache's hitbox, it was as if it was entering 'Focus Mode' as your rockets go straight through it. The rest of the other bugs however, like the one in Residue Processing, didn't stop me from progressing the full game and having fun.

Personally though, this game is not the best way to experience Half Life 1.
ну скажем так, очередная пародия на майкрафт. все квадратное и мне это нравится
still better than half life blue shift

This is an official "remake" of Half-Life. I use the word "remake" loosely because it's just a port of the original Half-Life built in Half-Life 2's Source Engine. Which in theory should be a good thing, an older game rebuilt in a newer game engine. Except instead of remaking the game properly Valve went about it in the laziest way possible. They just took the assets from Half-Life and dumped them into the Source engine. There's no real BIG difference between the two. But there are small differences between the two, most of which are bad.

There are some improvement from the original Half-Life that I can see. The enemies have rag doll physics. Some of the textures look slightly less muddy and the main menu has dynamic backgrounds like Half-Life 2 instead of just a JPG like in the original Half-Life. They used the Source Engine's dynamic lighting and particle effect system. Also some of the out door areas  have actual sky boxes instead of the low pixel still images the original game did. The water effects look better and the flashlight has a real time shadow effect now. Friendly NPC's AI has seen some noticeable improvements. While your escorting them it's harder for them to get lost.

However the issue is the game is noticeably buggy. Some bugs are bad enough that they do hurt the over all quality.

The ones I found are as follows.....

1. There's some screen tarring in a few places.

2. Some of the sound effects are... off. And that's because some of the sound effects have been removed and replaced with sound effects from Half-Life 2. Some of the sound effects were removed and replaced with nothing, making it so there's dead silence when some sound should be present. Some sound effects have been replaced with others, for example when you hit a wooden crate with your crowbar it's supposed to make that sound effect play but instead it plays the sound of you hitting a metal surface instead. No matter what surface you hit with your crowbar it will make the metal hitting sound effect, unless you hit an enemy. It's a lot louder and more ear piercing then most of the other sound effects which got on my nerves after a while. Seeing as you need to keep smashing wooden crates to get to the supplies inside.

3. The barnacle enemy's tugs don't always reach all the way down to the floor. Making it so they look like they're inactive but you'll get grabbed anyway. It's supper annoying that you can get grabbed and pulled up to ceiling after walking into nothing. There's also a section early on where the barnacle's are hidden behind some ceiling panels in a break room and their tugs clip through them. Making it so you can see them when your not supposed to.

4. There are times when the improved textures hurt the game rather that help it. Some areas are supposed to look dirty and trashed with blood stains and trash everywhere. But these areas look clean and spotless instead.

5. The weapon model on your magnum revolver looks weirdly shiny for some reason.

6. The MP5 has some weird sway effect now for some reason and dose way more damage. That includes when other people are using it, not just you.

7. If there's music playing when you hit a loading screen it'll just cut out when the loading screen ends.

8. If the security guard NPC's get injured while your escorting them they'll keep making that "oof" noise over and over again as if they're constantly getting injured.

9. There's this tentacle enemy you encounter in a few places like the blast pit in the rocket testing facility. This enemy is totally broken and can't deal any damage what so ever. The tentacles just clip right through you. Making it so you can just ignore them in every encounter.

10. The boss fight in Gonarch's Lair is kinda gimped. She won't attack you properly and instead will just stand around firing acid at you. When the acid hits the ground it will leave a black square shaped decal. 

11. During the mission Surface Tension the helicopter fight on the side of the cliff is broken too. The game doesn't give you enough rockets to shoot the helicopter down. So you'll be forced to use your other weapons to finish the job.

12. During the mission We Got Hostels in the original game there's a marine that kills a scientist but now that same marine dose nothing. This ruins a major story moment.

These are just the bugs I noticed while playing through the game once. There's some videos on YouTube by someone named Defenestrum that go into more detail.

All the improvements that Half-Life: Source makes to the original Half-Life game don't effect the gameplay all that much but all the things it dose worse dose effect the gameplay, mostly for the worst. Which is why I don't recommend playing this over the original. But there are two final nails in the coffin for me on this so called "remake"

The first one is that this version doesn't work with mods. The second is that there's now a real fan remake of Half-Life in the Source Engine called Black Mesa that's available here on Steam. So there doesn't seem to be much of a point in playing this or even for it to exist at all.

I'll give Half-Life: Source a Bethesda treatment out of 10
this is a good port of half life one, i like it since it has the half life 2 source engine

Half-Life: Source

So I purchased the steam bundle in the summer sale and heard many good things about HL and decided to give it a crack. I chose source over the original as it was the better looking of the two and I figured as it's a remaster it'll have less bugs. Oh BOI was I wrong.

I won't go into loads of detail like I normally do with reviews as I'm writing this one, warning you not to buy this game! It has numerous bugs and glitches, I even got to one point in the game where I had to skip chapters because there were things missing or parts of the script not working. It's lucky I was able to skip chapters or I wouldn't be able to finish the game! To cut it short, this is not the way to experience HL and you should only own it if you own the Valve bundle. 

4/10 ~ Neppy Review

Avoid this, stick to the original. "Remastered" means slightly updated lighting, "realistic" water that doesn't fit the aesthetic of everything else, countless new bugs, ragdolls that make the low-poly character models look even goofier, and a sense that every surface you wack with your crowbar is made of cardboard. There is no new content, no new models and textures, and very few genuine graphical improvements compared to the original Half-Life. Back in 2004, this was a tech demo to show off how easy it was to port Half-Life 1 content to the then-new Source engine - now it's just an incredibly strange remnant of Valve's history that for some reason is still being sold for money. 

If you want the original Half-Life, buy this:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/70/HalfLife/

If you want a true remake of Half-Life that takes advantage of the Source engine and then some, buy this:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/362890/Black_Mesa/
A bit frustrating, but it's good.

Es innegable el hecho de que jugar Half-Life: Source es mucho más entretenido que jugar a su versió original, más que nada debido a la implementación del motor Source a la entrega, lo cual le añadé detalles más apetecibles como los reflejos en el agua, o el Ragdoll para toda entidad y/o NPC del juego; sin embargo, dicha remasterización viene con un problema, que a simple vista podría parecer no la gran cosa, pero que, a la larga se convierte en algo muy incómodo, capáz y hasta es su único fallo, más dicho fallo terminá por convertir todo lo bueno, en algo regular y hasta incómodo de jugar, y esto es el tiempo de carga. A diferencia de su versión original, como ya todos recordaremos, el sistema de carga de mapas se basaba en generar el mapa a su paso, pero con la diferencia de que el sistema de carga era rápido, tardando como mucho 2 segundos. Pero en esta entrega Source, el tiempo de carga es exagerado, tardando hasta qun minuto con 20 segundos, lo cual, tomando en cuenta al original, lo convierte en algo muy pesado de soportar, eso sin mencionar que frena la emoción durante el trayecto, reduciendolo a una cara de aburrimiento cada vez que vemos que se esta generando de nuevo un tiempo de carga.
Time, Dr. Freeman? Is it really that time, again?
